intro: Mitreola darrisii, commonly known as the Darrisii bladderpod, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Mitreola darrisii is typically found in moist, sandy soils in woodland areas.
